channel.title: Cant connect to my own server?
channel.description: ok i recently got a new router i port forwarded again on it, my router is a dir-614 virgin broadband if thats any use and people can connect to my server but when i try getting on it i get "error connecting to server".

item.title: Cant connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @dancey88 dancey88
item.description:
@dancey88 wrote:

all normal stuff is set it worked before, the ip thing is 127.0.0.1, server ip is (im not saying) but anyways it worked before but now only i cant connect.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant connect to my own server?

item.title: Cant connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

There are some occasions when you can, I used to be able to use my IP address when I had two routers at once.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant connect to my own server?

item.title: Cant connect to my own server?
item.dc:creator: @Enoclious Enoclious
item.description:
@Enoclious wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:5, topic:369383”][quote author=Enoclious link=topic=465516.msg3404149#msg3404149 date=1290202646]

Are you using your local computer address as the server IP?

[font=times new roman]He shouldn’t have to.[/font]
[/quote]

In my experience, when hosting a server you generally have to connect using localhost, rather than the IP address of the computer.[/quote]
[font=times new roman]Oh. Well at least I’m able to do it. :X[/font]

Read full topic
